abstract.p: London Stock Exchange argues that takeover bid from OM Gruppen, Swedish company that runs Stockholm exchange, would represent loss of influence, inadequate value and unattractive business proposition; urges shareholders to reject hostile bid (S)

block.p: The London Stock Exchange argued in its official defense document that the takeover bid from OM Gruppen, the Swedish company that runs the Stockholm exchange, would represent a loss of influence, inadequate value and an unattractive business proposition, and it urged shareholders to reject the hostile bid. London exchange shareholders, the document asserted, would own just 18.5 percent of the merged entity, even though the exchange would contribute nearly half of the new group's profits. In the wake of its failed plan to merge with the Deutsche Borse, the London exchange has been the subject of merger speculation.
